page.title: 12Interviews (2)
page.content: Mrs Lamb has lived in the village for over 60 years. In that time she has seen many changes in the village and in the family business, Lamb's Garage. She thinks that the work in the garage has increased enormously with the greater number of vehicles but this has been offset by the acquisition of automatic petrol pumps, a hydraulic ramp and the readily interchangable parts for vehicles. In the village, Mrs Lamb has seen the introduction of electricity into the village and she will soon see the advent of gas for the first time. She has seen the building of two new schools (she is a Governor of the Primary School), the building of the Village Institute and the development of much new housing in the village. She feels that Hornby has retained much of its old community spirit.
